Material used.Description: Conditional transgenic mouse model, displaying region-specific expression of human mutant α-syn

Readout description.Result Description: Increased transgenic deposition into somatodendritic compartment of dopaminergic neurons, without generating fibrillar inclusions. Strong somatic accumulation of the mutant transgenic protein in several layers important for odor processing and colocalization with tyrosine-hydroxylase (TH) in olfactory DAergic neurons.

Basic positive control.Description: Sections from wild-type mice were used as positive controls for endogenous a-syn expression.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal distribution of a-syn in neuropil without somatic accumulation

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Increased somatic accumulation of a-syn in DAergic neurons.

Material used.Description: Subregional dissections of brain tissue from PrP_A30P and control mice

Readout description.Result Description: Detected a strong signal of monomeric a-syn in the olfactory bulb of transgenic mice. Higher molecular signals in the stacking gel suggest presence of aggregated a-syn, without urea-stable a-syn fibrils. Tight downregulation of a-syn with dox treatment.

Basic positive control.Description: Extracts from human cortex were used as positive control for a-syn expression.

Basic negative control.Description: a-syn knockout mice were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ImageQuant software was used to determine the optical density of protein bands and all data were normalized to the expression of β-actin.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Low expression level of a-syn in wild-type mice.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: High expression level of transgenic A30P a-syn in PrP_A30P mice

Material used.Description: Subregional brain dissection from PrP_A30P and control mice to measure dopamine (DA), DOPAC, and HVA levels

Readout description.Result Description: Reversibly reduced levels of dopamine and metabolites in the OB, suggesting an impact of A30P a-syn on olfactory neurotransmitter content. Elevated DA level in midbrain regions.

Basic positive control.Description: Brain samples from age-matched control mice.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test for pair-wise comparisons with post hoc Newman-Keuls test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: DA levels within normal range observed in control mice

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reduced DA and metabolite levels in OB; elevated DA levels in midbrain.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Behavioral Tests (Novel Open Field, TMT-induced fear, Female urine smell, Forced Swim Test, PhenoMaster)

Material used.Description: PrP_A30P mice and control mice used to assess behavior under novel, stressful and familiar conditions

Readout description.Result Description: Mutant A30P expression led to behaviorally hyperactive response correlated with novelty, odor processing and stress. Increased dopaminergic tone in midbrain regions. Indicated hyperactivity was triggered by novelty, odors and stress.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired two-tailed t-test, ANOVA, custom-made software

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Behavioral responses observed in control mice under different conditions.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Hyperactive responses under novel and stressful conditions; reduced activity under familiar conditions.

Material used.Description: Olfactory bulb tissue from PrP_A30P mice

Readout description.Result Description: Neurodegenerative changes on an ultrastructural level including degeneration of neuronal processes and solitary neurons in interconnected OB cell layers.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Evidence of neuronal degeneration, presence of lysosomes, glial response.

Readout description.Result Description: A mild reduction of TH-positive cells in olfactory bulb bordering significant level (p=0.08).

Basic positive control.Description: Brain samples from age-matched control mice.
